item.title: Lydia add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Success is stumbling from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Lydia add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "I'm a success today because I had a friend who believed in me and I didn't have the heart to let him down." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Lydia add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "It had long since come to my attention that people of accomplishment rarely sat back and let things happen to them. They went out and happened to things." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: Lydia add a quote by Dorothy Day
item.description: "Don't worry about being effective. Just concentrate on being faithful to the truth." -- Dorothy Day

item.title: Lydia add a quote by Peter S. Beagle
item.description: "Marveling at his own boldness, he said softly, "I would enter your sleep if I could, and guard you there, and slay the thing that hounds you, as I would if it had the courage to face me in fair daylight. But I cannot come in unless you dream of me." -- Peter S. Beagle

item.title: Lydia add a quote by Gloria Steinem
item.description: "I have yet to hear a man ask for advice on how to combine marriage and a career." -- Gloria Steinem

item.title: Lydia add a quote by Nora Ephron
item.description: "The desire to get married is a basic and primal instinct in women. It's followed by another basic and primal instinct: the desire to be single again." -- Nora Ephron

item.title: Lydia add a quote by Nancy Astor
item.description: "I married beneath me. All women do." -- Nancy Astor
